text: Triermain Castle was a castle near Brampton, Cumbria, England. ==History== The remains of Triermain Castle. Trierman was granted to Hubert I de Vaux by King Henry II of England in 1157. A manor existed on the site and in 1340, Roland de Vaux was given licence to crenellate his manor. the castle was constructed utilising stone robbed from Hadrian's Wall. The castle was ruinous by the mid 16th century. ==References== *Hugill, Robert. Castles and Peles of Cumberland and Westmorland. Frank Graham, Newcastle. 1977. pp. 179–180. Category:Castles in Cumbria Category:De Vaux family Category:City of Carlisle
title: Triermain Castle
